title: Findings of the First Mentorship in Speech Translation
author: Yasmin Moslem (Organizer), Juan Julián Cea Morán (Participant), Mariano Gonzalez-Gomez (Participant), Muhammad Hazim Al Farouq (Participant), Farah Abdou (Participant), Satarupa Deb (Participant), ...
relevance_why: The projects detailed in this paper utilize speech translation techniques that can inform Haohe Liu's work on audio processing and generative models, particularly in the context of audio-language integration.
background: The mentorship program focused on developing speech translation systems using both cascaded and end-to-end methodologies based on various language pairs.
contribution: This paper introduces a detailed analysis of mentorship efforts in speech translation, revealing effective techniques and model comparisons that enhance translation quality.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous systems largely segregated Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) and Machine Translation (MT) processes, limiting optimization opportunities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work highlights the superiority of cascaded systems over end-to-end approaches in various language contexts, providing empirical evidence to support this design.

key_innovation: Focuses on a mentorship model that facilitates collaboration across diverse participants, producing high-quality models and datasets for speech translation.
real_world_impact: The methodologies and datasets developed can significantly enhance real-world applications in multilingual communication technologies, such as translation apps and assistive technologies.
limitations: The projects may be limited by the specific language pairs chosen and the generalizability of the findings to low-resource languages.

new_terms.cascaded systems: **Cascaded systems** refer to a multi-step process in speech translation where separate models are trained for Automatic Speech Recognition and Machine Translation.
new_terms.end-to-end systems: **End-to-end systems** consolidate the speech translation process, utilizing a single model to directly map audio to translated text.
